alert.note: Alert for Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 03 at 10:53PM EST until February 05 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Bath, Estill, Menifee, Powell and Rowan. In southeast Kentucky, Lee, Morgan and Wolfe. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1052 PM EST, Doppler radar continued to light to occasionally moderate rainfall across the area. This will continue to keep small streams and creeks running high. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Morehead, Beattyville, Frenchburg, Campton, Fincastle, Wellington, Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest, Denniston, Mariba, Pomeroyton, Stoll, Korea, Artville, Scranton, Valeria, Ratlitt, Red River Gorge, Tabor, Maytown and Dan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
